meanings.definition: To have excessive optimism or confidence.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overhope for good outcomes in every situation.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, it is easy to overhope and ignore potential challenges.
meanings.sent3: His overhoping led to disappointment when things didn't go as planned.
meanings.sent4: Overhoping can blind us to the reality of a situation.
meanings.sent5: The danger of overhoping is that it can lead to overlooking important details.

meanings.definition: To place too much trust or expectation in something.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overhope in people, even when they have let me down before.
meanings.sent2: It is not wise to overhope in things that are beyond our control.
meanings.sent3: Overhoping in unreliable sources can lead to disappointment.
meanings.sent4: Placing all your trust in one thing can result in overhoping.
meanings.sent5: She learned the hard way the consequences of overhoping in the wrong person.

meanings.definition: To be overly hopeful or optimistic.
meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she continued to overhope for a positive outcome.
meanings.sent2: It is important to stay realistic and not overhope in every situation.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to overhope made him a cheerful person to be around.
meanings.sent4: Overhoping can sometimes lead to unexpected joy.
meanings.sent5: She overhoped for the best, even when others doubted her abilities.
